intro: [WRONG START] Lonicera ledeburii, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a deciduous shrub that produces vibrant, tubular flowers in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has opposite, simple leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping. The nectar-rich flowers attract bees and birds, contributing to its ecological value.
